FuncDef:
The match-type ipv6 qos-local-id enable command enables the IPv6 QoS local ID matching mode.
The undo match-type ipv6 qos-local-id enable command disables the IPv6 QoS local ID matching mode.
By default, the IPv6 QoS local ID matching mode is not enabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The rule based on the IPv6 QoS local ID cannot be configured in a common traffic policy. To allow a rule based on the IPv6 QoS local ID to be used in a traffic policy, enable the IPv6 QoS local ID matching mode. You can run the match-type ipv6 qos-local-id enable command to enable the IPv6 QoS local ID matching mode.
Precautions
This command can be configured only in the traffic policy where no traffic behavior is specified for a traffic classifier.
After the match-type ipv6 qos-local-id enable command is executed in a traffic policy, the traffic policy no longer supports IPv6 priority-based (DSCP, ToS, precedence) rules.
